title: Freddie Mercury's bizarre Bohemian Rhapsody lyrics were secret tribute to wife Mary
text:

Freddie Mercury 's bizarre lyrics to Bohemian Rhapsody could have been a secret tribute to his wife Mary.

The Queen frontman was married to Mary Austin from 1970 to 1975, and it's believed the unusual things Freddie sang were a message to her.

Freddie met Mary in the early 70s and they lived together for years, but by the middle of the decade, he'd begun an affair with a male record executive.

In 1976, Freddie told Mary he was gay, and their romantic relationship ended, but their close friendship continued.

And this classic rock opera song, released in 1975, is believe by many to be about Mary.

(Image: Redferns)

(Image: Getty Images)

Freddie, who composed the song, refused to explain it and said it was simply about relationships.

He once said: "It's one of those songs which has such a fantasy feel about it. I think people should just listen to it, think about it, and then make up their own minds as to what it says to them... Bohemian Rhapsody didn't just come out of thin air.

"I did a bit of research, though it was tongue-in-cheek and mock opera. Why not?"

Music scholar Sheila Whiteley believes the song is about Freddie's first gay love affair after seven years of living with Mary.

(Image: Getty Images)

(Image: Getty)

She says that the word 'Mama' in the song actually means 'Mary' - as in Mother Mary - so therefore the line 'Mama Mia let me go' really means 'Mary let me go'.

After they split, Freddie and Mary remained close friends until the day he died.

He moved out of the flat they shared and bought a home in Kensington, buying her a house of her own nearby.

Freddie would often refer to Mary as his only true friend.

(Image: YouTube)

(Image: Mirrorpix)

Speaking in 1985, he said: "All my lovers asked me why they couldn't replace Mary, but it's simply impossible.

"The only friend I've got is Mary, and I don't want anybody else. To me, she was my common-law wife. To me, it was a marriage. We believe in each other, that's enough for me."

Freddie is said to have written many songs about Mary, including Love Of My Life.

(Image: Getty Images)

He even became the godfather to her oldest son, Richard.

Other theories about Bohemian Rhapsody are that it tells the story of a suicidal murderer being hunted by demons or that it depicts the events preceding an execution.

It was originally dismissed by the band's record label, who said it was too long - at 5 minutes 55 seconds.

description: The iconic song's unusual lyrics have long been a topic of debate - but could they be a tribute to Mary?
